body.name: The Secret in a Lord’s Eyes: A Historical Regency Romance Novel
body.description: Lady Audrina Watson returns to Scotland after ten years, only to unexpectedly discover Laird Brian Campbell’s captivating presence. Her father’s prejudice against Brian’s people however, is an abrupt disruption of their potentially dreamy romance. Fortunately, her kind heart helps her see beyond her father’s disdain and Audrina’s affection for Brian only deepens. Yet, a future with him would be full of doubt and obstacles…If she cannot change her father’s mind, not even a courtship will be possible, let alone a marriage…The sudden death of his brother-in-law has left Laird Brian Campbell picking up the pieces and welcoming friends and relatives to pay their respects. The one he dreads to see though, is Audrina’s father, Bartley Watson, who never loses a chance to be rude to him. Luckily, Audrina’s mesmerising presence reminds him of a long lost hope against prejudice. Brian feels alive when he is with her, but when alone, the uncertainty of their future overpowers him.How could he ever court a lady, whose father hates the Scots more than anything?Young love blossoms between Brian and Audrina, and they desire nothing more than to be together. Yet, without Audrina’s father's blessing, their happy future can never be. Will Bartley Watson stubbornly refuse his daughter’s chance at happiness? If only there was something the young couple could do to fight his prejudice… Could love truly conquer all, or is Audrina destined to return to England alone and utterly heart-broken?"The Secret in a Lord’s Eyes" is a historical romance novel of approximately 60,000 words. No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a guaranteed happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Secret in a Lord's Eyes
reviews.reviewText: Patience is a virtue and the lord's paid off with his reward being the woman he wanted as his wife. It was a struggle but he continued to do so. Perseverance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Her Scottish love
reviews.reviewText: Great story wonderful story line, great characters. Audrina's father did not like the Scott's, but Brian and Audrina wasn't about to let her father keep them apart, so they fought for their love, fighting against her father's bigotry. Thank you ♥️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I mostly enjoyed this book. I admit that the ordeal with her father dragged a bit, but I enjoyed the other characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a great story to read. It as a little bit of everything, resentments, misunderstandings, reconciliation, and love. The story of Audrina, Brian, Grace and Hamish, and Adriana's father dislike for the Scott's, brought a lot of dislikes, but in the end they all understood his reasons, even if it was a selfish one. He did changedand blessed his daughter's love and wedding to Brian. Grace and Hamish also had a happily ever after. A great book to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Although I tired of the many times A said she had no choice — because she did have a choice — and I wanted her to agree to the “anvil” to force her father to agree to give his blessings, clearly the author had a different idea, and the HEA was very satisfactory. I enjoyed the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good story
reviews.reviewText: This story focuses on Audrina, her parents and her cousin visiting Scotland to provide support to the family of a cousin who has died. Audrina has fallen for the widow’s brother, Brian, who she knew as a child, and his feelings are mutual. Her father is anti-Scotland anything. This becomes the foundation of the story. Knowing her father to be an opinionated brut, the drama is finding a way for him to allow Audrina and Brian to marry, once their secret tryst is discovered. How do they derail such a huge hurdle of her father rejecting anything to do with Scotland? There are other key characters that makes this an engaging read. For me, the beginning of the story moved slowly, but eventually events occur moving the plot along as the couple navigate various hurdles until reaching their HEA. I enjoyed the story. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Secret in a Lord's Eyes
reviews.reviewText: A very good story about a Scottish laird and a English lady that are in love but the father is very against Scots but love wins The plot is good and the characters are realistic A enjoyable read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Overcoming prejudices and bigotry to gain the one you love
reviews.reviewText: This historical regency romance of Aria Norton’s is set in the beautifully described area of Inveraray, Scotland and deals with an English lady, Audrina Watson, and a Scottish Laird, Brian Campbell, having to overcome the prejudices and bigotry of her father, Bartley Watson, in order to gain his blessings for their marriage. Many things will play into Bartley Watson’s heart being changed but the biggest is how Laird Brian handles him with kindness, humbling himself and keeping his temper under control. The characters are developed so that they come alive off the page and the book is well written grammatically and flows easily making the book irresistible to put down. It’s a clean stand-alone, HEA with 2 Scottish brothers to enjoy, and it includes adorable twin girls and puppies. Yes, it has it all!

reviews.reviewTitle: A lovely romance set in Scotland
reviews.reviewText: Lady Audrina Watson has not visited Scotland for ten years. Laird Brian Campbell is wowed when he sees the grown-up woman. Their attraction continues to build, even though her father is prejudiced against Scots and lets everyone know it. Andrea and her parents are there to support Brian’s sister, Catriona, in the son loss of her husband James Watson in a carriage accident. Wonderful transformations occur throughout the story. A lovely read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: More than great value for the price
reviews.reviewText: True family values, friendships and brotherly love. It showed how opinions can change and the patience and manners showed by the main character were what helped him with his true love. Wonderfully written thoroughly enjoyed reading this novel.
